arm_group.description: Healthy volunteers and patients with esophageal motor symptom will be enrolled and esophageal motility assessed by transnasal endoscopy according to clinical and manometric diagnosis

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to assese esophageal motor function by simplified transnasal
      endoscopy compared with esophageal manometry.

clinical_study.brief_title: Assessment of Esophageal Motility With Transnasal Endoscopy

detailed_description.textblock:
Esophageal manometry is a gold standard for diagnosis of esophageal motility disorder.
      However, esophageal manometry can not detect non-occulsive contraction. Endoscopic
      evaulation of esophageal motility is difficult becausea swallowing is nearly impossible
      during endoscopy. Simplified trans nasal endoscopy (E.G. ScanTM, IntroMedic
      Co.,Ltd.)composed with dysplay system,controller,and disposable probe with compact size.

      The esophageal motor function will be assessed with both esophageal manometry and simplifed
      trnasnasal endoscopy in patients with esophageal motility disorder (such as achalasia) and
      healthy volunteer. The results of simplifed trnasnasal endoscopy is compared with the
      results of esophageal manometry.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  1) Healthy volunteer without organic esophageal or gastric disorder 2) Patients knwon
             esophageal motility disorder (such as achalasia)

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  severe organic esophageal disorder including severe reflux esophagitis, stricture,
             and bleeding.

          -  previous opertion of esophagus or stomach

          -  GI bleeding, mechanical obstruction

          -  medication which can infulence GI motility

study_pop.textblock: Patients with esophageal motility disorder Healthy volunteer

oversight_info.authority: Republic of Korea: Korea Food and Drug Administration (KFDA)

primary_outcome.measure: Agreement of endoscopic diagnosis of esophageal motor function with manometry

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.measure: Discomfort of simplifed transnasal endoscopy compared with esophageal manomerty estimated by the patietns

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Case-Only, Time Perspective: Prospective
